intro: Jurinea mongolica, commonly known as the Mongolian sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to harsh, saline environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils. It has a low-growing habit with a rosette of basal leaves and produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. Jurinea mongolica is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological resilience in extreme climates.
